titleInfo.title: Letter from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The bottom edges of the folios of this letter have suffered from insect damage, which has resulted in the loss of text.

mods.abstract: In this letter Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, informs William Newnham, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay, that on 19 January he will board the Company cruiser, the Aurora, in order to visit the piratical ports on the Arabian coast. Stannus estimates that his trip will last no longer than a month. Stannus states that Assistant Surgeon, James Pringle Riach, will be in charge of the Residency during his absence. Other matters discussed include the case of a suspected pirate at Sharga [Sharjah], a quarrel between Rama bin Jauber [Rahma bin Jabir] and Bahrein [Bahrain] and the expected arrival from Persia of His Royal Highness's messenger.
